title: Electric flux - Flux through Face A from X Y and Z

content.question: Three small, identical spheres each have the same amount of positive charge distributed uniformly throughout their volumes. As shown in the figure, the spheres are located on or inside a cube as follows. Sphere <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> is at the midpoint of the bottom-left edge of the cube, Sphere <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> is at the center of the bottom face, and Sphere <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math> is at the center of the cube. The front-left face of the cube is labeled Face <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>. Which of the following correctly ranks the electric flux magnitudes <math alttext="phi sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="phi sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="phi sub Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> through Face <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> due to the electric fields of the three spheres?

choices.label: <math alttext="phi sub X equals phi sub Y, which equals phi sub Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>Φ</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub></math>

<math alttext="phi sub X is greater than phi sub Y, which equals phi sub Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub></math>

<math alttext="phi sub Y equals phi sub Z, which is greater than phi sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></math>

<math alttext="phi sub Z is greater than phi sub Y, which is greater than phi sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="phi sub Z is greater than phi sub Y, which is greater than phi sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></math>

unit.text: 8: Electric Charges, Fields, and Gauss's Law

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
